detail: Build a cloud-connected Android app, and learn the tools, principles, and best practices of mobile and Android development that you'll apply to your own projects.
title: Developing Android Apps

detail: Show off what you've learned in your Nanodegree program with a project that defines
title: Deep Learning

detail: Learn the basics of Android and Java programming, and take the first step on your journey to becoming an Android developer!
title: Android Development for Beginners

detail: Learn how to make your apps interactive using buttons and text! In this course you'll learn the basics of the Java programming language and how to apply them to Android.
title: Android Basics: User Input

detail: Learn to build multiple screens and link them together, expanding the range of apps you can create! You'll also learn how to play audio and add images to your apps.
title: Android Basics: Multi-screen Apps

detail: This class teaches the basics of networking using Android, and is a part of the Android Basics Nanodegree by Google.
title: Android Basics: Networking

detail: In this course, you'll learn the basics of data storage in Andriod, building your first database and an app that could be used for any small business!
title: Android Basics: Data Storage

detail: Get hands-on experience making web applications accessible. You’ll understand when and why users need accessibility, then you’ll dive into how to implement.
title: Web Accessibility

detail: Learn how a client communicates with a server, including HTTP's request and response cycle, HTTP/2 and HTTPs.
title: Client-Server Communication

detail: Make your app production-ready by applying advanced features like library integration, material design, widgets, receiving cloud messages, and more!
title: Advanced Android App Development

detail: Build bigger and better Android and Java apps using the Gradle build tool.
title: Gradle for Android and Java

detail: Enhance your apps with Google's Fused Location Provider, Activity Recognition, and Geofencing API capabilities.
title: Google Location Services on Android

detail: Where in the world are people using your app? And how are they using your app? Take this course to learn how to answer these questions!
title: Google Analytics for Android

detail: Maps on mobile devices have changed the world for millions of users. Learn how to use the Google Maps API to extend this functionality to your apps.
title: Add Google Maps to your Android App

detail: Performance matters to users, so it must matter to you. Learn how to identify and fix bottlenecks in your Android applications, and ensure a smooth user experience.
title: Android Performance

detail: Learn and apply the material design principles that define Android's visual language to your apps.
title: Material Design for Android Developers

detail: Learn how to extend your app to Android Wear smartwatches, allowing you to reach users wherever and whenever they'd want or need your app.
title: Android Wear Development

detail: Go where your users are: the living room! This course shows you how to extend your existing Android app to also work on Android TV, and/or with Google Cast.
title: Android TV and Google Cast Development

detail: Reach your users while they're out and about by extending your Media or Messaging app to Android Auto!
title: Android Auto Development

detail: Acquire the know-how necessary to see your business grow towards its next milestone.
title: Get Your Startup Started

detail: Learn product validation, UI/UX practices, Google’s Design Sprint and the process for setting and tracking actionable metrics.
title: Product Design

detail: Learn how to effectively develop, implement, and measure your monetization strategy, iterating on the model as appropriate.
title: App Monetization

detail: Learning to prototype will save you time and money in the development process. You’ll create quality apps faster and have confidence in the viability of your products.
title: Rapid Prototyping

detail: This course will help you organize a strategy of identifying your perfect user, and teach you how to grow your user base by focusing your product on their needs.
title: App Marketing

detail: This course explores how to use LibGDX to build 2D games that run anywhere, from web browsers to mobile devices. At the end you will create a full game, called Icicles.
title: 2D Game Development with libGDX

detail: This course will explore how to create a game called Giga Gal. Giga Gal is a platformer in which you run, collect energy packs, jump a bunch, and shoot enemies.
title: How to Make a Platformer Using libGDX

detail: Sinatra is a micro-framework for quickly developing small Ruby applications for the web. In this course, you'll learn all about Sinatra, routing, and templating.
title: Dynamic Web Applications with Sinatra

detail: In this course you’ll learn how to organize your code, and why that’s important. You’ll be using the MVC Design Pattern in the web application micro-framework Sinatra.
title: The MVC Pattern in Ruby

detail: Deploy your first web application using the Heroku platform and learn about the underlying mechanics of web hosting.
title: Deploying Applications with Heroku

detail: Learn a scientific approach to solving problems with data, a foundational skill for anyone interested in making data driven decisions in a business context.
title: Problem Solving with Advanced Analytics

detail: Learn how to prepare data to ensure the efficacy of your analysis while improving fluency in Alteryx.
title: Creating an Analytical Dataset

detail: Learn how to use classification predictive models to solve business problems involving non-numeric data.
title: Classification Models

detail: The A/B Testing course provides students with the foundational knowledge to design and analyze A/B tests to create business insights and support decision making.
title: A/B Testing for Business Analysts

detail: Learn how to develop offline-first web application using Service Workers and IndexedDB.
title: Offline Web Applications

detail: Learn how to simplify asynchronous work with Native JavaScript Promises!
title: JavaScript Promises

detail: Increase conversions with best practices for fast, efficient forms! Learn how to design and build web forms for users on any device.
title: Building High Conversion Web Forms

detail: In this course, you’ll learn how to setup your development environment and save a lot of time and effort with automatic optimization.
title: Web Tooling & Automation

detail: Build and secure a web server with a RESTful Developer-Friendly API that developers will love to use.
title: Designing RESTful APIs

detail: Documentation is an important part of the development process. Learn to write READMEs using Markdown so your code can be used by other humans!
title: Writing READMEs

detail: Learn all about the DevOps landscape, workflow, and a survey of the systems currently being used to support scalable software deployment.
title: Intro to DevOps

detail: Learn how to convert digital design mockups into static web pages and how to build a responsive portfolio site to showcase your work.
title: Intro to HTML and CSS

detail: Learn key computer science concepts in this introductory Python course. You'll learn by doing, and will build your own search engine and social network.
title: Intro to Computer Science

detail: Learn JavaScript syntax and coding conventions that web developers use to create interactive and dynamic websites while you create an online résumé for your portfolio.
title: JavaScript Basics

detail: An introduction to the Linux command line interface.
title: Linux Command Line Basics

detail: Learn to use version control, an important tool for any developer. The course will focus on Git, a specific version control system, and GitHub, a collaboration platform.
title: How to Use Git and GitHub

detail: Introductory programming class to learn Object-Oriented Programming, a must-have technique to reuse and share code easily. Learn by making projects that spread happiness!
title: Programming Foundations with Python

detail: Take the first step in becoming an iOS Developer by learning about Swift and writing your first app.
title: Intro to iOS App Development with Swift

detail: Start with this basic introduction to Java programming if you've never studied the language before and practice essential computer science concepts.
title: Intro to Java Programming

detail: Relational databases are a powerful tool used throughout the industry. Learn the basics of SQL and how to connect your Python code to a relational database.
title: Intro to Relational Databases

detail: Learn the fundamentals of back-end web development by creating your own web application from the ground up using the iterative development process.
title: Full Stack Foundations

detail: Learn to implement the OAuth 2.0 framework to allow users to securely and easily login to your web applications.
title: Authentication & Authorization: OAuth

detail: Learn and practice strategies for developing websites that look great on every device! Made with Google's Pete LePage.
title: Responsive Web Design Fundamentals

detail: Go beyond image tags! Learn how to make images a part of your responsive design workflow.
title: Responsive Images

detail: This course will demystify the browser's rendering pipeline and make it easy for you to build high performance web apps.
title: Browser Rendering Optimization

detail: You will learn about challenges of building applications that can serve hundreds of thousands of users, and how you can prepare for them as a developer.
title: Developing Scalable Apps in Python

detail: Learn the importance of code organization and how to implement it with either vanilla JavaScript or an organizational library or framework.
title: JavaScript Design Patterns

detail: This is a collection of curated resources to teach you how to write well organized web applications using the Backbone framework.
title: Learn Backbone.js

detail: Learn how to iterate on your web applications with confidence using the red-green-refactor workflow cycle and automated testing frameworks.
title: JavaScript Testing

detail: Serve a data-driven web application as you become acquainted with, configure and finally secure a Ubuntu Linux web application server.
title: Configuring Linux Web Servers

detail: Learn what it takes to build a successful startup using the Customer Development process, where entrepreneurs "get out of the building" to gather and iterate on feedback.
title: How to Build a Startup

detail: This course focuses on the syntax of the Swift programming language. By the end of the course, you'll be able to apply Swift essentials to building iOS apps.
title: Learn Swift Programming Syntax

detail: Learn the iOS UIKit framework, which is the cornerstone of creating user interfaces in all iOS apps and crucial for any iOS Developer to be intimately familiar with.
title: UIKit Fundamentals

detail: This course will teach you when and why to choose Firebase as a backend for your iOS application.
title: Firebase in a Weekend: iOS

detail: This course will teach you when and why to choose Firebase as a backend for your Android application.
title: Firebase in a Weekend: Android

detail: Learn how to incorporate networking into your apps to access data from around the world. Build the On the Map app to share location and fun links with fellow students.
title: iOS Networking with Swift

detail: Learn how to prevent background operations from interfering with an app's UI by implementing Apple's GCD framework.
title: Grand Central Dispatch (GCD)

detail: Persisting data is a core skill for any iOS developer. Learn how to store app data to your device using three common techniques: NSUserDefaults, Sandbox & Core Data.
title: iOS Persistence and Core Data

detail: Learn the process of building an app, taking your ideas from drawing board to App Store!
title: How to Make an iOS App

detail: In this course, you'll learn standard methodologies for debugging software, and how to use Xcode's debugging tools to find and squash bugs.
title: Xcode Debugging

detail: Design and implement an A/B test to determine the efficacy of potential improvements to an online site or mobile app while specifying metrics to measure.
title: A/B Testing

detail: Learn the fundamentals of data visualization and apply design and narrative concepts to create your own visualization.
title: Data Visualization and D3.js

detail: This class will teach you the end-to-end process of investigating data through a machine learning lens, and you'll apply what you've learned to a real-world data set.
title: Intro to Machine Learning

detail: In this short course, learn the fundamentals of MapReduce and Apache Hadoop to start making sense of Big Data in the real world!
title: Intro to Hadoop and MapReduce

detail: The world is trending in real time! Learn Apache Storm, taught by Twitter, to scalably analyze real-time tweets and drive d3 visualizations. Storm is free, open and fun!
title: Real-Time Analytics with Apache Storm

detail: Explore a variety of datasets, posing and answering your own questions about each. You'll be using the Python libraries NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib.
title: Intro to Data Analysis

detail: What does a data scientist do? In this course, we will survey the main topics in data science so you can understand the skills that are needed to become a data scientist!
title: Intro to Data Science

detail: Starting from the basics of how the web works, you will learn everything you need to know to build your own blog and scale it to support large numbers of users.
title: Web Development

detail: Build a variety of JavaScript objects and explore how their inheritance models affect your app's in-memory model. Gain simplicity and modularity in your own code.
title: Object-Oriented JavaScript

detail: Learn how you can use HTML5 Canvas to create and modify images or even interactive animations.
title: HTML5 Canvas

detail: Learn how to access and modify the DOM with ease using jQuery!
title: Intro to jQuery

detail: Learn how to perform asynchronous requests as you build a web app with data from Google Street View, the New York Times and Wikipedia!
title: Intro to AJAX

detail: This course will introduce you to the basics of AI. Topics include machine learning, probabilistic reasoning, robotics, computer vision, and natural language processing.
title: Intro to Artificial Intelligence

detail: Data is everywhere and so much of it is unexplored. Learn how to investigate and summarize data sets using R and eventually create your own analysis.
title: Data Analysis with R

detail: This is a design course made for developers. You'll learn UX design skills which will help you make 5-star mobile apps that your users will love.
title: UX Design for Mobile Developers

detail: In this short class you'll build powerful apps without writing code. Great if you're an aspiring developer or someone who wants to learn what programmers do.
title: Intro to Point & Click App Development

detail: You will learn about challenges of building applications that can serve hundreds of thousands of users, and how you can prepare for them as a developer.
title: Developing Scalable Apps in Java

detail: Learn the fundamentals of parallel computing with the GPU and the CUDA programming environment by coding a series of image processing algorithms. #filters, #cuda.
title: Intro to Parallel Programming

detail: Intro to Descriptive Statistics will teach you the basic concepts of statistics that can be used to extract information from data.
title: Intro to Descriptive Statistics

detail: Intro to Inferential Statistics will teach you how to test your hypotheses and begin to make predictions based on statistical results drawn from data!
title: Intro to Inferential Statistics

detail: Introduction to Operating Systems teaches the basic operating system abstractions, mechanisms, and their implementations.
title: Introduction to Operating Systems

detail: Learn tools and techniques that will help you recognize when problems you encounter are intractable and when there an efficient solution.
title: Computability, Complexity & Algorithms

detail: The twin goals of knowledge-based artificial intelligence (AI) are to build AI agents capable of human-level intelligence and gain insights into human cognition.
title: Knowledge-Based AI: Cognitive Systems

detail: Implement machine learning based strategies to make trading decisions using real-world data.
title: Machine Learning for Trading

detail: The HPCA course covers performance measurement, pipelining, and improved parallelism through various means.
title: High Performance Computer Architecture

detail: This course will give you solid foundations for developing, analyzing, and implementing parallel and locality-efficient algorithms. Offered at Georgia Tech as CS6220
title: High Performance Computing

detail: This survey course provides a broad, forward-facing overview of contemporary health informatics within the context of the US healthcare delivery system.
title: Health Informatics in the Cloud

detail: This is an advanced Computer Networking course that delves into the latest concepts and tools used by the CN industry.
title: Computer Networking

detail: This class explores how computation impacts the entire workflow of photography, which is traditionally aimed at capturing light from a 3D scene to form a 2D image.
title: Computational Photography

detail: Software Development Processes explores requirements engineering, architecture and design, testing, and software quality in general.
title: Software Development Process

detail: Software Architecture and Design teaches the principles and concepts involved in the analysis and design of large software systems.
title: Software Architecture & Design

detail: Learn how to program all the major systems of a robotic car. Topics include planning, search, localization, tracking, and control.
title: Artificial Intelligence for Robotics

detail: This course provides an introduction to computer vision including fundamentals, methods for application and machine learning classification.
title: Introduction to Computer Vision

detail: This class is an an introductory course about educational technology offered as CS6460 at Georgia Tech where it is a part of the Online Masters Degree (OMS).
title: Educational Technology

detail: Study machine learning at a deeper level and become a participant in the reinforcement learning research community.
title: Reinforcement Learning

detail: Learn linear algebra by doing: you will code your own library of linear algebra functions!
title: Linear Algebra Refresher Course

detail: Data Scientists spend most of their time cleaning data. In this course, you will learn to convert and manipulate messy data to extract what you need.
title: Data Wrangling with MongoDB

detail: This course will teach you how to start from scratch in understanding and paying attention to what is important in the data and how to answer questions about data.
title: Model Building and Validation

detail: This course will provide you with the insight to start recognizing the role of design in today’s world, and to start making better design decisions in your own life.
title: Intro to the Design of Everyday Things

detail: In this course, you'll learn how to build great mobile web experiences. We'll cover performance issues on mobile, and how to make use of mobile sensors.
title: Mobile Web Development

detail: Learn how browsers convert HTML, CSS and JavaScript into websites while you experiment with Chrome Developer Tools to measure and optimize website speed!
title: Website Performance Optimization

detail: Ten minutes into this class you'll make your own completely personalized version of the insanely addictive game 2048. Even if you've never coded before. Pretty cool, no?
title: Make Your Own 2048

detail: Learn how to build high-performance web games with HTML5. We'll port industry-standard development techniques to the web and use them to create a game.
title: HTML5 Game Development

detail: Cryptography is present in everyday life, from paying with a credit card to using the telephone. Learn all about making and breaking puzzles in computing.
title: Applied Cryptography

detail: Get ready to analyze, visualize, and interpret data! Thought-provoking examples and chances to combine statistics and programming will keep you engaged and challenged.
title: Intro to Statistics

detail: A brief review of introductory algebra topics including integer operations, scientific notation, algebraic expressions, linear equations, and graphing.
title: Intro Algebra Review

detail: Gain an in-depth understanding of algebraic principles and learn how to use them to solve problems you may meet in everyday life.
title: College Algebra

detail: Learn the basics of Algebra through intuition and problem solving! From fractions to factors to functions, we’ll cover a breadth of topics.
title: Visualizing Algebra

detail: Learn how to catch bugs and break software as you discover different testing methods that will help you build better software.
title: Software Testing

detail: This class will give you an introduction to the design and analysis of algorithms, enabling you to analyze networks and discover how individuals are connected.
title: Intro to Algorithms

detail: This course will teach you the principles of 3D computer graphics: meshes, transforms, lighting, animation, and making interactive 3D applications run in a browser.
title: Interactive 3D Graphics

detail: This course is an introduction to the fundamentals of programming languages. Concepts include how to specify and process valid strings, sentences and program structures.
title: Programming Languages

detail: Learn how to model problems, and how to optimize performance by using some of the advanced features of Python.
title: Design of Computer Programs

detail: Write Python code to find numerical solutions to systems of differential equations. The models you create will fight wildfires, bring spaceships back to earth, and more!
title: Differential Equations in Action

detail: In this course you will learn how to debug programs systematically using scientific methods and build several automated debugging tools in Python.
title: Software Debugging

detail: Learn the basic concepts in theoretical computer science. Discover what they imply for solving tough computational challenges.
title: Intro to Theoretical Computer Science

detail: In this course, you'll learn how to apply Supervised, Unsupervised and Reinforcement Learning techniques for solving a range of data science problems.
title: Machine Learning

detail: Go to the places where big physics discoveries were made in the past and make them yourself. You’ll visit Italy, the Netherlands, and the UK as you learn basic physics.
title: Intro to Physics

detail: Learn the basics of genetics, with a personal twist. This class is all about DNA and how it shapes who we are.
title: Tales from the Genome

detail: Go on a journey through psychological concepts and principles to enable you to gain a more in-depth understanding of human thought and behavior.
title: Intro to Psychology

detail: In this OMS Orientation, we cover several things you will need to know to be a successful OMS student.
title: OMSCS Student Orientation

detail: This course covers the essential Operating Systems concepts students need in preparation for the rest of the GT "Advanced Operating Systems" sequence.
title: GT - Refresher - Advanced OS

detail: We live in a time of unprecedented access to information. You'll learn how to use statistics to interpret that information and make decisions.
title: Statistics

detail: You will learn the most effective monetization strategies for your game, how to keep your players interested and engaged, so that your game stands out in the app store.
title: Engagement & Monetization | Mobile Games

detail: Ever wonder how Netflix can predict what movies you'll like? Or how Amazon knows what you want to buy before you do? The answer can be found in Unsupervised Learning!
title: Machine Learning: Unsupervised Learning

detail: You've used the Internet. Now find out more about how it works.
title: Networking for Web Developers

detail: Test course only - please ignore if you see this
title: A/B Testing (Certified Course)

detail: Build a cloud-connected Android app, and learn the tools, principles, and best practices of mobile and Android development that you'll apply to your own projects.
title: Developing Android Apps

detail: Build a cloud-connected Android app, and learn the tools, principles, and best practices of mobile and Android development that you'll apply to your own projects.
title: Developing Android Apps

detail: Explore and build interactive, single-page applications with popular JavaScript frameworks!
title: Front End Frameworks

detail: This introductory Nanodegree program teaches you the foundational skills all programmers use. It's ideal for beginners who want make informed choices about career goals.
title: Intro to Programming

detail: Learn the skills technical interviewers expect you to know—efficiency, common algorithms, manipulating popular data structures, and how to explain a solution.
title: Technical Interview

detail: Deploy your own Hadoop cluster to crunch some big data!
title: Deploying a Hadoop Cluster

detail: Learn to build a multiuser blog with Google App Engine that permits users to sign in
title: Intro to Backend

detail: This course is designed to teach you about managing microservices, using Kubernetes. This course is built in partnership with experts such as Google’s Kelsey Hightower.
title: Scalable Microservices with Kubernetes

detail: Learn the distinguishing language features of Objective-C. Practice Objective-C syntax by writing classes, and writing and calling methods.
title: Objective-C for Swift Developers

detail: This course will introduce you to the content available through the Google Maps APIs through building a real-estate listings web application step-by-step.
title: Google Maps APIs

detail: In this course you’ll get started working on your very first Progressive Web App - a web app that can take advantage of many features native applications have enjoyed!
title: Intro to Progressive Web Apps

detail: Take your first steps towards becoming a Java developer! Learn Java syntax and create conditional statements, loops, and functions.
title: Java Programming Basics

detail: In this course, we introduce the characteristics of medical data and associated data mining challenges on dealing with such data. We cover various algorithms and systems.
title: CSE 8803 Special Topics: Big Data

detail: The Time Series Forecasting course provides students with the foundational knowledge to build and apply time series forecasting models in a variety of business contexts.
title: Time Series Forecasting

detail: The Segmentation & Clustering course provides students with the knowledge to build and apply clustering models to develop sophisticated segmentation in business contexts.
title: Segmentation and Clustering

detail: Learn the fundamentals of data visualization and practice communicating with data.
title: Data Visualization in Tableau

detail: This survey course provides a broad, forward-facing overview of contemporary health informatics within the context of the US healthcare delivery system.
title: Introduction to Health Informatics

detail: If you are interested in learning more about virtual reality, this course will teach you the principles of VR technology and help you understand what you can build in VR.
title: Introduction to Virtual Reality

detail: Take the first step in Unity and begin to develop VR content. Learn the principles of the Unity platform and help you understand what you can build in VR!
title: VR Scenes and Objects

detail: Learn about the world of virtual reality programming! You will learn the basics of programming in C# and how to use it control virtual reality applications in Unity.
title: VR Software Development

detail: Learn Swift, Apple's programming language for building iOS applications. Start with the basics and work your way towards completing sets of challenges in Swift.
title: Swift for Beginners

detail: Get a quick practical introduction to Swift programming basics and build your first iOS app!
title: Swift for Developers

detail: With this course, you will learn about AutoLayout and how to use stack views and constraints to create pixel-perfect UIs.
title: AutoLayout

detail: Learn the best practices for creating iOS interfaces. Build adaptive interfaces, animate UI elements, and analyze designs from popular apps on the App Store.
title: Building iOS Interfaces

detail: In this course, you'll explore iOS design patterns — the practical and battle-tested solutions to common problems that are used everyday by developers.
title: iOS Design Patterns
